what: Support Access to the Aedes Connectome Dataset
title: Support Access to the Aedes Connectome Dataset
text: aedes package provides programmatic access progress Aedes aegypti connectome dataset. Note dataset still early state proofreading annotation access currently limited pre-release testing phase develop robust community infrastructure.

title: Support Access to the Aedes Connectome Dataset
text: package delivered thin wrapper around fafbseg optional registration coconatfly. familiar users fancr bancr packages. CAVE package must access appropriate token recorded. Metadata project stored seatable web-accessible database accessed via fafbseg::flytable_* functions wrapped package. CAVE datasets concept active materialisation version defines state segmentation used analysis. Alternatively timestamp can specified allow exact point time used.

title: Support Access to the Aedes Connectome Dataset
text: package must installed github: also need additional one time setup. Access segmentation / connectivity information via CAVE. use python CAVE client hood must installed via simple_python(). Authentication via token, typically shared across CAVE projects (e.g. flywire, FANC, BANC etc). can make new one linked email address authorised access web resources via neuroglancer. order start using flytable, must get API token. doesn’t seem convenient way seatable web interface can get one calling flytable_set_token() flytable user password. step. Thereafter FLYTABLE_TOKEN environment variable set .Renviron file.
code: if (!requireNamespace("natmanager", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("natmanager") } natmanager::install(pkgs = "flyconnectome/aedes") # required  fafbseg::simple_python()  # Will open browser to get new token fafbseg::flywire_set_token() # Writes a known token to correct location fafbseg::flywire_set_token("2f88e16c4f21bfcb290b2a8288c05bd0")  fafbseg::flytable_set_token()

title: Support Access to the Aedes Connectome Dataset
text: recommend using coconatfly analysis. moment must tell coconatfly aedes dataset per R session.
code: library(aedes) library(coconatfly)  # once per session register_aedes_coconat()

title: Support Access to the Aedes Connectome Dataset
text: Select smaller set PN neurons type matching G2X Now can cluster connectivity. depends partner neurons kind identity recorded, typically via type column (default) numeric group column (often set even formal type proposed). time writing PN input partners (ORNs) well typed downstream partners less . let’s just use input partners also restrict neurons already typed n=2 neurons type small plot.  wealth options clustering. can select input partners using group column rather type defining neuron-type connectivity matrix. can turn partner grouping (can actually work better circumstances limited partner type information available) able co-cluster L R homologues. default threshold setting 5 synapse may little restrictive dataset synapses counts seem low (even without considering proofreading).
code: library(dplyr)  # 1) List neurons with class ALPN alpn_meta <- cf_meta(cf_ids(aedes = "/class:ALPN")) alpn_meta %>% count(subclass, subsubclass) #>   subclass subsubclass   n #> 1     ALPN      BI_MUL  21 #> 2     ALPN      BI_UNI   8 #> 3     ALPN      II_MUL 214 #> 4     ALPN      II_UNI 329 gpn_ids <- cf_meta(cf_ids(aedes = "/type:G2[0-9].*PN")) #> Updating 3 ids #> Updating 245 ids gpn_meta <- cf_meta(gpn_ids) #> Updating 245 ids gpn_meta %>% count(type, side) %>% tidyr::spread(side, n) #>        type L  R #> 1   G20_lPN 2  2 #> 2   G21_lPN 3  3 #> 3  G22_adPN 1  1 #> 4   G23_lPN 3  3 #> 5   G24_lPN 2  2 #> 6   G25_lPN 1  1 #> 7   G26_lPN 1  1 #> 8  G27_adPN 1  1 #> 9  G28_adPN 1  1 #> 10 G29_adPN 1  1 #> 11 G29_lvPN 1 NA gpn_meta %>%    add_count(type) %>%    filter(n==2) %>%    cf_cosine_plot(partners = 'in') #> Updating 245 ids #> Updating 245 ids #> Warning in coconat::partner_summary2adjacency_matrix(x[["inputs"]], inputcol = #> groupcol, : Dropping: 940/1320 neurons representing 12245/27020 synapses due to #> missing ids! #> Updating 245 ids cf_cosine_plot(gpn_ids, heatmap = T, partners = 'in') cf_cosine_plot(gpn_ids, heatmap = T, partners = 'in', group = 'group') cf_cosine_plot(gpn_ids, heatmap = T, partners = 'in', group = FALSE) cf_cosine_plot(gpn_ids, heatmap = T, partners = 'in', group = FALSE, threshold = 2) #> Updating 245 ids #> Updating 245 ids #> Updating 245 ids

what: Query Aedes tables in the CAVE annotation system — aedes_cave_query

text: Query Aedes tables CAVE annotation system

title: Query Aedes tables in the CAVE annotation system — aedes_cave_query
code: aedes_cave_query(   table,   datastack_name = NULL,   version = NULL,   timestamp = NULL,   live = is.null(version),   timetravel = FALSE,   filter_in_dict = NULL,   filter_out_dict = NULL,   filter_regex_dict = NULL,   select_columns = NULL,   offset = 0L,   limit = NULL,   fetch_all_rows = FALSE,   ... )

title: Query Aedes tables in the CAVE annotation system — aedes_cave_query
text: table Table name. datastack_name Optional datastack name. Defaults active Aedes datastack. version optional CAVE materialisation version number. See details examples. timestamp optional timestamp string POSIXct, interpreted UTC timezone specified. live Whether use live query mode, updates root ids current value (another timestamp provided). Values TRUE 1 select CAVE's Live mode, 2 selects Live live mode gives access even annotations part materialisation version. See section Live Live Live queries details. timetravel Whether interpret version/timestamp defined point past latest annotations sent back time, recalculating root ids necessary. filter_in_dict, filter_out_dict, filter_regex_dict Optional arguments consisting key value lists restrict returned rows (keeping matches filtering matches). Commonly used selected rows specific neurons. See examples CAVE documentation details. select_columns Either character vector naming columns python dict (required query involves multiple tables). offset 0-indexed row number, allows page long results (see section CAVE Row Limits caveats) limit whether limit number rows per query (NULL implies client side limit typically server side limit 500,000 rows). fetch_all_rows Whether fetch rows query exceeds limit (default FALSE). See section CAVE Row Limits caveats. ... Additional arguments passed fafbseg::flywire_cave_query().

title: Query Aedes tables in the CAVE annotation system — aedes_cave_query
text: data.frame.

title: Update ids in aedes_main table manually — aedes_flytable_update
text: now part scripted updates flyem even future may occasionally useful trigger manually. Expert use : scheduled job updates root IDs FlyTable every 30 minutes, function normally needed. root_duplicated column ticked root_ids one entry setting aside rows status=duplicate.

title: Return metadata about Aedes neurons from FlyTable — aedes_meta
code: aedes_meta(   ids = NULL,   ignore.case = FALSE,   fixed = FALSE,   version = NULL,   timestamp = NULL,   unique = FALSE,   ... )  aedes_ids(   ids,   ignore.case = FALSE,   fixed = FALSE,   unique = FALSE,   version = NULL,   timestamp = NULL,   ... )

title: Return metadata about Aedes neurons from FlyTable — aedes_meta
text: ids Root IDs (character/int64) query string like "class:ALPN". ignore.case query strings, whether ignore case. fixed query strings, whether treat queries fixed strings rather regular expressions (default FALSE). version Optional CAVE materialisation version. timestamp Optional CAVE timestamp. unique Whether drop duplicate root_id rows (duplicates attached attribute). ... Additional arguments passed fafbseg::cam_meta() (e.g. cache controls expiry, refresh).

title: Return metadata about Aedes neurons from FlyTable — aedes_meta
text: aedes_meta(), data.frame metadata. aedes_ids(), vector root IDs.

title: Return metadata about Aedes neurons from FlyTable — aedes_meta
text: version timestamp specified, root ids returned data frame mapped corresponding timepoint using supervoxel_id column. version/timestamp specified ids simply returned flytable (updates every half hour). want sure ids match date state segmentation possible can ask timestamp='now'.

title: Return metadata about Aedes neurons from FlyTable — aedes_meta

title: Register Aedes dataset for coconatfly — register_aedes_coconat
text: aedes dataset continually evolving. three two main choices handle . use specific numeric version (aka materialisation) segmentation. use latest materialisation version (version='latest') map ids current time (version='now') Option 2 default since can make queries somewhat faster stable note 'latest' can several days old.
